content.2: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, These
content.3: Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted,
content.4: Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof:
content.5: And the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he
content.6: And the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he
content.7: And the swine, though he divide the hoof, and be clovenfooted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he
content.8: Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch; they
content.9: These shall ye eat of all that
content.10: And all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of any living thing which
content.11: They shall be even an abomination unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, but ye shall have their carcases in abomination.
content.12: Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that
content.14: And the vulture, and the kite after his kind;
content.16: And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
content.17: And the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,
content.18: And the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle,
content.19: And the stork, the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
content.20: All fowls that creep, going upon
content.21: Yet these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon
content.24: And for these ye shall be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the even.
content.27: And whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on
content.28: And he that beareth the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: they
content.30: And the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.
content.34: Of all meat which may be eaten,
content.39: And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcase thereof shall be unclean until the even.
content.40: And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
content.41: And every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth
content.42: Whatsoever goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon
content.43: Ye shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.
content.47: To make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten.
